title: Dave Roberts will be back as Los Angeles Dodgers manager in 2020, per report
text:
CLOSE USA TODAY Sports' Steve Gardner breaks down how the Nationals were able to advance to the NLCS. USA TODAY

Despite a painful loss to the Washington Nationals in the National League Division Series, the Los Angeles Dodgers are sticking with manager Dave Roberts, sources have told the Los Angeles Times.

Roberts was widely criticized for his bullpen decisions during Game 5 of the NLDS, when the Dodgers blew a 3-1 lead in the eighth inning and eventually lost in the 10th.

"If the blame falls on me, I've got no problem with it," Roberts said afterward. "I feel that my job is to put guys in the best position to have success. And if it doesn’t work out, there’s always going to be second-guessing. I’ve got no problem wearing the brunt of that."

Dodgers manager Dave Roberts has a career record of 393-256 (.606) in four seasons at the helm. (Photo: Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY Sport)

Roberts, who led the Dodgers to the NL West division title in each of his four seasons at the helm, has three years remaining on a contract he signed last winter after a second consecutive World Series appearance.

During the 2019 regular season, the Dodgers racked up a franchise-record 106 victories, winning the division by 21 games.
description: Despite an early playoff exit, the Dodgers don't plan on making a change with manager Dave Roberts, sources told the Los Angeles Times.
